dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 6118 IH: Stand with Israel Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. Luna (for herself, Mr. Ogles, Mrs. Miller of Illinois, Mrs. Spartz, Mr. Biggs, Mr. Weber of Texas, Mr. Babin, Mr. Santos, Mr. Brecheen, Mr. Moskowitz, Mr. Van Drew, Mr. Curtis, Ms. Malliotakis, Mr. Burlison, Mr. Steube, and Mr. Gooden of Texas) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To prohibit funding for the United Nations Human Rights Council until it condemns Hamas.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stand with Israel Act.

section.header: Prohibition on funds for the United Nations Human Rights Council

subsection.text: Congress finds that Hamas, Iranian backed terrorists, on October 7, 2023, launched a massive, unprovoked war on Israel by firing thousands of rockets, gunmen storming Israeli homes killing whoever they could find, resulting in the death and abduction of countless Israeli and American civilians.

No Federal funds may be obligated or expended to provide assessed or voluntary contributions or any other funding to the United Nations Human Rights Council until the United Nations Security Council and United Nations General Assembly adopts a resolution to condemn Hamas relating to its actions described in subsection (a).
